p: Compound 3, a phenolic compound with two hydroxyl groups in its structure, contains cyclic hydrocarbon with methylene and methyl. In the ESI positive ionization mode, compound 3 was protonated at the oxygen atom of one of the hydroxyl groups to form the parent ion [M + H] + with an m/z of 349. The cyclic rearrangement and removal of C 4H 6, C 5H 8, C 6H 10, and C 10H 18 from the parent ion produced ions with an m/z of 295, 281, 267, and 211, respectively. Removal of a water molecule from the parent ion produced an ion with an m/z of 331, which was further fragmented to produce an ion with an m/z of 313 by removal of another water molecule. The loss of C 3H 4 from the parent ion led to the formation of an ion with an m/z of 309, this was followed by the loss of C 14H 11O to form an ion with an m/z of 114.
